alerts.headline: fog advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring over some areas.

Locally dense fog will persist into Saturday morning before dissipating.

###

Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: If visibility is reduced while driving, turn on your lights and maintain a safe following distance.

affected_areas.area_description: Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake

alerts.headline: severe thunderstorm watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing large hail and heavy rain.

Hazards:
Hail 2 to 3 cm in diameter
Locally heavy rainfall

Timing:
After midnight into  early Saturday morning.

Discussion:
Thunderstorms have developed and are tracking eastward over the area.

###

Local utility outages are possible.

Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms capable of producing damaging hail, wind or rain.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

For more information: https://www.ontario.ca/page/be-prepared-emergency.
alerts.instruction:
When thunder roars, go indoors! Lightning kills and injures Canadians every year.

Emergency Management Ontario recommends that you take cover immediately if threatening weather approaches.

alerts.headline: fog advisory ended
alerts.description:
Visibilities have improved and are no longer expected to meet fog advisory criteria.

alerts.headline: severe thunderstorm watch ended
alerts.description:
Conditions are no longer favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms.


###

alerts.headline: rainfall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Rain, at times heavy, is expected.

What:
Total rainfall amounts of 50 to 75 mm. Amounts in excess of 75 mm are possible for areas that receive multiple thunderstorms.

When:
This evening through Sunday.

Additional information:
Showers, at times heavy, and thunderstorms are expected to move through northwestern Ontario ahead of a low pressure system. The significant rainfall will move from southwest to northeast, with multiple rounds of heavy showers possible for some areas, before tapering off late Sunday.

###

Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Watch for possible washouts near rivers, creeks and culverts.

alerts.description:
Rain, at times heavy, is expected.

What:
Total rainfall amounts of 50 to 75 mm. Amounts in excess of 75 mm are possible for areas that receive multiple thunderstorms.

When:
This evening through Sunday.

Additional information:
Showers, at times heavy, and thunderstorms are expected to move through northwestern Ontario ahead of a low pressure system. The significant rainfall will move from southwest to northeast, with multiple rounds of heavy showers possible for some areas, before tapering off late Sunday.

For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources office. Visit Ontario.ca/floods for the latest details

###

Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

affected_areas.area_description: Summer Beaver - Wunnummin Lake - Kingfisher Lake

alerts.headline: squall watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 50 knots, frequent lightning, hail and poor to very poor visibility in showers heavy at times.

Severe thunderstorms are possible this evening into early Sunday morning.

###

Poor to very poor visibility may contribute to voyage delays and make marine navigation hazardous. Large hail can damage vessels and cause injury.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Mariners are advised to prepare for potential squalls. Vulnerable vessels are most at risk and should seek safe harbour if underway.

alerts.headline: severe thunderstorm watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, damaging hail and torrential rain.

###

Utility outages are possible. Significant damage to property, buildings and trees is possible.

Heavy rain can cause flash flooding and significant reductions to visibility.

Strong wind gusts can damage trees, buildings and overturn vehicles.

Large hail can cause significant damage and injury.

Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms capable of producing damaging hail, wind or rain.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

For more information: https://www.ontario.ca/page/be-prepared-emergency.
alerts.instruction:
When thunder roars, go indoors! Lightning kills and injures Canadians every year. Don't drive through flooded roadways.

Emergency Management Ontario recommends that you take cover immediately if threatening weather approaches.

alerts.headline: severe thunderstorm watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, damaging hail and torrential rain.

Hazards:
Large hail up to 5 cm diameter.
Strong wind gusts up to 90 km/h.
Locally heavy rainfall.

Timing:
This evening to early Sunday morning.

Discussion:
An unseasonable mild and unstable air mass may allow for the development of severe thunderstorms tonight. Scattered thunderstorms are expected to develop this evening along an advancing warm front. Any storms that develop may produce up to golf ball sized hail, strong winds and torrential rain. The severe threat is expected to diminish by early Sunday morning but scattered non-severe thunderstorms may still be ongoing.

###

Utility outages are possible. Significant damage to property, buildings and trees is possible.

Heavy rain can cause flash flooding and significant reductions to visibility.

Strong wind gusts can damage trees, buildings and overturn vehicles.

Large hail can cause significant damage and injury.

Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms capable of producing damaging hail, wind or rain.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

For more information: https://www.ontario.ca/page/be-prepared-emergency.
alerts.instruction:
When thunder roars, go indoors! Lightning kills and injures Canadians every year. Don't drive through flooded roadways.

Emergency Management Ontario recommends that you take cover immediately if threatening weather approaches.
